Award.AbstractNarration:
The thirty second Southeastern-Atlantic Regional Conference on Differential Equations (SEARCDE) will be held at Wake Forest University, on October 19-20, 2012. The conference website is http://www.math.wfu.edu/SEARCDE2012. This conference has met annually since 1981. It was initiated by members of the Department of Mathematics at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University and has since then rotated among the research institutions in the southeast. The location chosen for this year event is the Wake Forest University campus, which is centrally located in the southeast and has hosted many well-attended meetings in the past, including two previous SEARCDE conferences.

This conference brings together many researchers under the broad umbrella of Differential Equations. Both theoretical and applied approaches are well represented. Distinguished plenary speakers are invited from both within and without the region. The conference also provides a supportive environment where students and new PhDs can present their research and interact with more seasoned experts. Supporting the development of new researchers is one of the central goals of SEARCDE.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The primary objective of the Southeastern Atlantic Regional Conference on Differential Equations (SEARCDE) is to bring together established and new researchers for the exchange of ideas in the wide field of mathematics encompassed within the title, differential equations. This conference provides opportunities for young researchers to present their work to an expert audience and to interact with more experienced mathematicians. The sessions are such that talks by extablished researchers are interspersed with talks by beginning researchers. The invited lectures of eminent mathematicians provides an opportunity to broaden ones knowledge of the field, and to become aware of important open problems and opportunities for new directions of research. A wide range of topics related to differential equations are covered, both theoretical and applied.

The 32nd Southeastern Atlantic Regional Conference on Differential Equations was held on October 19-20, 2012, at Wake Forest University. This conference featured plenary talks by four distinquished speakers (mentioned below) as well as many other researchers. The conference encourages interaction amongst a broad range of participants, and encourages contributed talks from all areas related to Differential Equations. SEARCDE has developed a particular reputation for welcoming and encouraging new researchers, i.e. students and postdocs, and SEARCDE 2013 continued this tradition. 

The invited speakers were Andrea Bertozzi (University of California at Los Angeles), Carlos Castillo-Chavez (Arizona State University and Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Ratnasingham Shivaji (University of North Carolina at Greensboro), and Gigliola Staffilani (Massachusetts Institute of Technology). All four gave excellent talks, and all four were generous with their time in interacting with other participants.

There were a total of 104 participants. 41 new researchers attended and were supported by NSF funds This number included 12 new PhDs and 29 graduate students.
